alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 2:26AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of around one tenths to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Iowa, Iowa, Johnson, Cedar and Clinton Counties. In Illinois, Carroll County. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are likely. The hazardous conditions are expected to impact the commutes Wednesday evening and Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
